ts.title: Typescript
ts.content: I've been a fan of JavaScript and its frameworks for years. So, as an evolution of JS, TypeScript is one of my favorites programming languages to create solid and robust code.

angular.title: Angular
angular.content: A powerful framework to create flexible and scalable web experiences. It has been my go-to framework for front-end development for the last 3 years.

html.title: HTML & CSS
html.content: The barebones of a good and responsive website. Using HTML and CSS to slowly but surely create the design you envisioned is one of the most rewarding feelings ever.

worki.title: Worki Process
worki.content: A graphic editor that lets you create, edit and design workflows for your agile projects on the Worki Process web app. It was made using Angular and integrated into the app with the collaboration of the Worki Process team for my Degree Final Project.

employee-manager.title: Employee Manager
employee-manager.content: A practice project that involves creating a back-end server with Spring Boot and integrate it with Angular. The motivation was to learn more about back-end development since I consider a front-end developer must have a somewhat deep understanding of how it works.

jemarhe.title: Jemarhe.com
jemarhe.content: This very own website. I made it entirely from scratch, using everything I know: from applying design fundamentals to creating a mock-up and making it into a reality using HTML, CSS, and Angular.
